Description: Pair of baggy white cotton bridal trousers (srauleen hatem) with narrow cuffs finely embroidered in silk or rayon multicoloured patterns. A draw-string belt of nylon (?) from another garment (?), also embroidered in silk or rayon multicoloured patterns, has been inserted into the waist-band.
Curator's comments: Eth.Doc.119. Purchased by vendor in Cairo, December 1990. Made and embroidered in Siwa.
Acquisition notes: Af1991,01.1 to 9 were purchased from Delia Pemberton. They are decribed as "a small collection of ethnographic objects including garments and accessories which form part of the bridal trousseau in Siwa Oasis, Egypt. The objects were purchased by the vendor in December 1990." See Eth.Doc.119.
